conclusion: To determine which containers (D, E, or F) A, B, and C will flow into, we need to trace the paths of their respective flows based on the arrangement of the baffles.
A is pink and the flow is directed towards the right.
The flow from A hits a baffle that redirects it downward.
After going down, the flow from A encounters another baffle that directs it to the right again.
The flow from A finally flows into container F.
B is green and flows towards the right.
The flow from B hits a baffle that redirects it downward.
The flow from B flows straight down without further redirection and enters container F.
C is blue and flows towards the right.
The flow from C hits a baffle that redirects it downward.
The flow from C then hits another baffle that directs it back to the right.
The flow from C finally flows into container F.
Therefore, all liquids from A, B, and C flow into container F.
